intro: Eugenia michelii, commonly known as the Mexican cherry or wild cherry, is a small evergreen tree native to Central America and Mexico. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and fragrant white flowers. The plant produces small, red, fleshy berries that are edible and often used in local cuisines. Eugenia michelii thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight. Its ornamental value and culinary uses make it a notable species in botanical gardens and local ecosystems.
